articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A blast at a hospital in Gaza City killed some 500 Palestinians on Tuesday in the deadliest single incident since Israel launched an unrelenting bombing campaign in retaliation for the Oct. 7 Hamas cross-border attack.
articles.title: Reactions to strike on Gaza hospital killing hundreds

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Gaza health ministry spokesman said hundreds were killed in a blast at a Gaza City hospital that Israeli and Palestinian officials blamed on each other and that ignited protests in the West Bank and around the Middle East.
articles.title: Israel and Hamas at war: Latest news

articles.author: Gabrielle Tétrault-Farber
articles.description: A strike on the Al-Ahli al-Arabi Hospital in the north of the Gaza Strip that killed hundreds was "unprecedented in scale," the World Health Organization (WHO) said on Tuesday, condemning the attack.
articles.title: Attack on Gaza hospital 'unprecedented' in scale, WHO says

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: The United Nations Security Council will now vote on Wednesday on a Brazilian-drafted resolution that calls for humanitarian pauses in the conflict between Israel and Palestinian militants Hamas to allow humanitarian aid access to the Gaza Strip.
articles.title: UN Security Council to vote Wednesday on Israel-Gaza conflict

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Jordan's King Abdullah on Tuesday warned against trying to push Palestinian refugees into Egypt or Jordan, adding that the humanitarian situation must to be dealt with inside Gaza and the West Bank.
articles.title: King Abdullah on Gaza: 'No refugees in Jordan, no refugees in Egypt'

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli air strike killed senior Hamas armed commander Ayman Nofal in Gaza, the Hamas armed wing Izz el-Deen Al-Qassam Brigades said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Israeli air strike kills senior Hamas armed commander Ayman Nofal in Gaza

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Africa said on Tuesday its foreign minister held a call with the leader of Hamas about getting aid into Gaza and other Palestinian territories and denied a report of offering support to the militant group in its conflict against Israel.
articles.title: South Africa says it discussed aid with Hamas leader, denies reports of support

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Steve Holland
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden flies to Israel on Wednesday to signal support for its war against Hamas after a deadly blast at a Gaza City hospital inflamed tensions and led to the cancellation of his planned summit with Arab leaders.
articles.title: Biden heads to Middle East inflamed by Gaza hospital blast

articles.author: Dan Williams
articles.description: One Israeli cabinet minister was barred from a hospital visitors' entrance. Another's bodyguards were drenched with coffee thrown by a bereaved man. A third had "traitor" and "imbecile" shouted at her as she came to comfort families evacuated during the horror.
articles.title: Whatever unfolds in Gaza war, judgment day looms for Netanyahu

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Social media platform X, formerly known as Twitter, said on Tuesday it will test a new subscription model under which it will charge $1 annual fee for basic features.
articles.title: X social media to test $1 annual subscription for basic features
